page.title: 05A BUS DRIVER IN BURTON
page.content: Page 1(of 2) After working at a brewery and a power station Mr. Ireland took to driving a double-decked, 155 horse-power bus round Burton, carrying up to 78 people at a time. Mr. Ireland enjoys his work. He gets to know the town and the district, and, since changing to one-man buses, he meets many people every day. It is, however, a very stressful job, and many drivers suffer from nerves through having to drive to a time-table despite bad weather, traffic jams and other hold-ups. Fortunately,Burton is a quiet town, and there is no trouble with rowdy passengers,as there is in the big cities.Sometimes bad-tempered people annoy the driver,but he has to remember he is a public servant and stay cool.
